stanza.line: Full many a glorious morning have I (a)seen(/a)
Flatter the mountain tops with sovereign (b)eye(/b)
Kissing with golden face the meadows (a)green(/a)
Anon permit the basest clouds to (c)ride(/c)
With ugly rack on his celestial (d)face(/d)
And from the forlorn world his visage (c)hide(/c)
Stealing unseen to west with this (d)disgrace(/d)
Even so my sun one early morn did (e)shine(/e)
With all triumphant splendour on my (f)brow(/f)
But out alack he was but one hour (e)mine(/e)
The region cloud hath masked him from me (f)now(/f)
Yet him for this my love no whit (g)disdaineth(/g)
Suns of the world may stain when heaven's sun (g)staineth(/g)
